org.sadun.util.cache2
Interface CacheController

All Superinterfaces:
CacheListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
CacheControllerAdapter, SizeBasedCacheController, TimeExpirationController
public interface CacheController
extends CacheListener

Objects implementing this interface control when or not an item in a Cache can be inserted and/or has expired.

Typically a controller implements some kind of criteria in getExpirationState(Object) to determine wether or not an item is to be considered expired.

Author:
Cristiano Sadun

Method Detail

getExpirationState

public CacheExpirationState getExpirationState(java.lang.Object key)
Queries whether or not a key has expired. If the key does not exists in the cache, returns null.

Parameters:
key - the key for which to retrieve the expiration state
Returns:

canInsert

public boolean canInsert(java.lang.Object key,
                         java.lang.Object value,
                         boolean keyExists)
Queries whether or not a key can be inserted in the cache.

Parameters:
key - key the key for which to determine if insertion is possible
value - the value for which to determine if insertion is possible
keyExists - true if the key already exists in the cache

queuedForExpiration

public void queuedForExpiration(java.lang.Object key)
Notifies the controller that a given key has been queued for expiration. An expired notification will be sent later on.

Parameters:
key - the key which is due to expire
